Save the changes made to the part stitches?

Would you like to limit the detection to empty assocations (the lines in red)? If you select not to, all current association will be removed and the detection will make no assumptions on the overall layout.

Cover

Each frame can hold an image representing a part of the book cover. Since book covers often have rounded edges, they might require an image with transparent parts. However, images with transparency can't be efficiently compressed and might not be suitable if exported in certain contexts. You can therefore define opaque and transparent versions of the cover images.
Any cover part that is undefined will be given a default image if exported. You can drag files and images on to these frames to define their content. Use the right click to delete the content of a frame.

 Rotate all the parts a quarter turn clockwise
 Stitch together parts that don't line up

Poster stitching

This is a poster being stitched into a seamless document.
This process can be manual or automatic.
Once the parts are correctly assembled, use the   render button to produce a single document.

Manual stitching

You can click and drag the parts around the canvas.
The corners of the parts have handles allowing you to resize them.
Press CTRL while moving a handle to rotate the part.
If the parts can't be seamlessly assembled with these manipulations, you can edit the stitches by first selecting a part (the selected part has a yellow outline) and then right clicking on different part. This will open the stitch editor.

Stitch editor

The stitch editor provides tools for stitching together two parts which means finding points of overlap between the two and joining them into a single image.
